docs.snippet: A FORGOTTEN book of Sir Richard Francis Burton, explorer, Orientalist and pilgrim to Mecca, was entitled "Letters From the Battlefields of Paraguay." It was written toward the end of his consulship at Santos, Brazil. In that country he had lived five...
docs.lead_paragraph: A FORGOTTEN book of Sir Richard Francis Burton, explorer, Orientalist and pilgrim to Mecca, was entitled "Letters From the Battlefields of Paraguay." It was written toward the end of his consulship at Santos, Brazil. In that country he had lived five years. He was attracted to the conflict between little Paraguay and Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay, one of the most tragic wars in history.
docs.abstract: Quoted in feature article on Paraguayan war of 1865-71

headline.main: THE CONFLICT THAT BLED PARAGUAY WHITE; In the War Which Began in 1865 the Little Country, Opposed to Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay, Lost Most of Its Population

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 4. -- Argentina is frankly puzzled by Chile's sudden outbursts of hostility. It was Chile that suggested that Presidents Justo and Alessandri exchange visits, and it was Chile that gave out the first announcement that the visits...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 4. -- Argentina is frankly puzzled by Chile's sudden outbursts of hostility. It was Chile that suggested that Presidents Justo and Alessandri exchange visits, and it was Chile that gave out the first announcement that the visits had been agreed upon.
docs.abstract: int; supports Chilean charge that Argentina is prolonging Chaco war

docs.snippet: After a year of relative stability following the revaluation of the dollar, the world money markets have again been rocked by wild and unpredictable fluctuations. Sterling has succeeded the dollar as the "sick man" among the currencies of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: After a year of relative stability following the revaluation of the dollar, the world money markets have again been rocked by wild and unpredictable fluctuations. Sterling has succeeded the dollar as the "sick man" among the currencies of the nations.
docs.abstract: Dollar's position considered in view of Brit situation

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges backed and filled last week as nervously as they had in the preceding fortnight, when the incident of the decision in the gold-clause suit, followed by the statement of the British Chancellor that there was no early hope for...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges backed and filled last week as nervously as they had in the preceding fortnight, when the incident of the decision in the gold-clause suit, followed by the statement of the British Chancellor that there was no early hope for stabilization of the pound, were the determining factors.
